0.text: Bug 8757  Type Hierarchy view - Error decoration not removed when error fixed.

1.text: Eclipse 200201129-I Windows 2000  1) Focus on the hierarchy of class (one that has a few super classes).

2.text: 2) Cause a compile error to happen in the class and save the change.

3.text: 3) Select a different class in the hierarchy and then select the class with   the error.

4.text: Note that now the label at the top of the methods list in the  TypeHierarchy view nows has a red x on it.

5.text: I don't know why you have to flip  between classes to make this red x appear - it should appear as soon as you  save the change that caused a compile error.

6.text: 4) Now fix the compile error and save the change.

7.text: The red x does not disappear  from the label above the methods list.
